basics.name: Gabriel Béna
basics.label: Neuromorphic Researcher
basics.summary: PhD candidate in neuromorphic computing at Imperial College London and Neuromorphic Researcher at SpiNNCloud. Passionate and driven, with strong capabilities and interest in programming and natural sciences.

work.name: SpiNNcloud
work.summary: Freelance work based in Dresden, Germany focusing on neuromorphic computing applications and software development.
highlights: Designing and deploying deep SNNs on neuromorphic chips
Utilizing hybrid approaches to leverage the best of conventional and neuromorphic computing
Tackling multiple optimisation and physics problems as neuromorphic applications
Active software development and improvement of py-spinnaker2

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: PhD in the Neural Reckoning Group under the supervision of Dan Goodman, focusing on Spiking Neural Networks and neuromorphic computing.
highlights: Study Spiking Neural Networks (SNNs) and uncover principles underlying the spike-based computational paradigm
Study the relationship between structure and function in NNs, especially in modular & multimodal architectures
Leverage these insights to advance neuromorphic computing

work.name: Prophesee
work.summary: Internship in Paris, France working on event-based cameras and neural networks.
highlights: Trained deep spiking neural networks for event-based cameras
Created spiking auto-encoders for denoising and compressing tasks
Worked on end-to-end event-based systems using Intel's LOIHI processor and Prophesee's event-based cameras

education.area: Data and Decision Science, Machine Learning applied to Space Systems
